description: From Latin errhīnum, from Ancient Greek ἔρρινον (érrhinon), from ἐν (en, “in”) + ῥίς (rhís, “nostril”).

adjectives.description: errhine (comparative more errhine, superlative most errhine)

entries.meaning: (medicine, rare) Causing an increase in mucus within the nose, and hence causing one to sneeze.
(medicine, uncommon) A medicine applied inside the nose to increase the production of mucus, and hence sneezing.
